result.execSummary:
The defendant Lamell Antonio Kelly was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Resisting/Failing to Stop, an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 346.04(2t).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.descr: House of Correction - Imposed and Stayed

miscConds.notes:
Provide a DNA sample. Defendant to pay all non-waivable costs, assessments and surcharges, including the DNA surcharges during the period of probation. Failure to pay the costs and surcharges will result in a civil judgment. Court WAIVED all other court costs, fees, and surcharges due to inability to pay.
- Pay supervision fees.
- Court set restitution at zero.

- No new law violations rising to the level of probable casue.
- Not to operate a motor vehicle without a valid driver's license.
- Cooperate with agent for all home and office visits.
- AODA assessment; comply with any treatment.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Lamell Antonio Kelly

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Lamell Antonio Kelly in court with attorney Sylvan Jaspen.  William R. F. Ackell appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Parties prepared to proceed with sentencing. Statements by each counsel and defendant as to sentencing.

Court sentenced the defendant to serve 6 MONTHS in the House of Correction, with Huber privileges, with credit for 0 days served. Court STAYED the sentence and placed the defendant on probation for 1 YEAR.

CONDITIONS OF PROBATION:
- No new law violations rising to the level of probable cause.
- Cooperate with agent for all home and office visits. 
- AODA assessment; comply with any treatment.
- Not to operate a motor vehicle without a valid drivers license. 
- Complete 25 hours of community service. 

- Provide a DNA sample. 
- Pay supervision fees.
- Defendant to pay all non-waivable costs, assessments and surcharges, including the DNA surcharges during the period of probation. Failure to pay the costs and surcharges will result in a civil judgment. Court WAIVED all other court costs, fees, and surcharges due to inability to pay.

- Court set restitution at zero.

*Court advised defendant of appellant rights. 

Filed: 
Notice of Right to Seek Post-Conviction Relief, 
Memorandum of Conditions of Probation

Defendant Lamell Antonio Kelly in court with attorney Sylvan Jaspen.  William R. F. Ackell appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Amended Information filed.  Copy given to defense counsel who waived reading.  Defendant pled not guilty. Parties have reached a resolution. State places offer on the record. Defense and defendant are in agreement.  

Defendant changes plea to GUILTY as to COUNT 1 of the AMENDED INFORMATION.  

Defendant examined as to plea, advised of Constitutional rights and the maximum penalty.  Defendant further advised that if not a US citizen deportation is possible. Court found that defendant freely, voluntarily and intelligently waived their rights.  Plea questionnaire, addendum and jury instructions received and filed.  Parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis to sustain defendant's plea. Court found defendant guilty as charged in the information and ordered a Judgment of Conviction be entered on the record.

Filed:
Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights
Addendum to Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights
Jury instructions
Letter on behalf of Lamell Kelly

Defendant Lamell Antonio Kelly in court with Attorney Sylvan Jaspen.  William R. F. Ackell appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Case in court for scheduling conference.  Defense requests plea/sentencing date.  Court set date as requested.  Case adjourned to Branch 45.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for June 10, 2022 at 02:30 pm.

Defendant Lamell Antonio Kelly in court with Attorney Sylvan Jaspen.  Matthew Zisi appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  PARTIES APPEAR BY VIDEO.
Preliminary hearing proceeded.  Sworn for the State: Brown Deer Officer J. Morgan.  State rests.  Defense rests.  Defense motion to dismiss argued and denied. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Original information received and filed;  defendant given a copy, waived reading, was arraigned in open court and plead not guilty.  Case is adjourned to Branch 45.  Scheduling conference scheduled for March 31, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Atty Sylvan Jaspen received and filed

No driving without a valid license.
DEFENDANT WAS ORDERED BY THE COURT TO REPORT TO THE MILWAUKEE COUNTY JAIL (CJF) TO BE BOOKED AND RELEASED BY 5:00 P.M. ON 02/10/2022. IF THEY FAIL TO APPEAR A BENCH WARRANT WILL BE ISSUED FOR THEIR ARREST.

Defendant Lamell Antonio Kelly in court with attorney Dawn Marie Rablin.  Catelin Ringersma appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Kies, Branch 45.
Defendant given a copy of complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed complaint and found probable cause to hold defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT DOES QUALIFY FOR PUBLIC DEFENDER REPRESENTATION.  Case is adjourned for preliminary hearing in Branch PE.
  Preliminary hearing scheduled for February 23, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Summons mailed.  Defendant ordered into room 221 Safety Building on 2/88/2 @ 2p
